title: Setup problems
body:
I face a lot of issues when settings this up.

First off, where do I place the config.py? In the base directory? running mongo_setup.py results in a No module named config when doing this.

I also get AttributeError: module 'datetime' has no attribute 'now' when running mongo_setup.py fixing this by adding "from datetime import datetime"

Next error is this: 

python3.10 helper_files/mongo_setup.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/x/Documents/trading/AmpyFin/helper_files/mongo_setup.py", line 90, in <module>
    initialize_market_setup()
  File "/Users/x/Documents/trading/AmpyFin/helper_files/mongo_setup.py", line 83, in initialize_market_setup
    collection.insert_one({"market_status": "closed"})
  File "/opt/homebrew/lib/python3.10/site-packages/pymongo/synchronous/collection.py", line 401, in __call__
    raise TypeError(
TypeError: 'Collection' object is not callable. If you meant to call the 'insert_one' method on a 'Database' object it is failing because no such method exists.

Help is appreciated!!
author: Knallli

comments.body: I had datetime preinstalled from other projects but just updated requirements.txt to help with this. Thanks for bringing this up. also you have to put config in the base directory. Please let me know if the issue persists.

yes you are right. this isn't to do with python version but the file location. i have moved the mongo set up to base and it should work now. Thank you for pointing this out and my apologies. Please let me know if the set up works. Thank you!! :)

Some problems still persist with the changes. I changed Line 4 to "from datetime import datetime"

I still get TypeError: 'Collection' object is not callable. If you meant to call the 'insert_one' method on a 'Database' object it is failing because no such method exists. from the function in line 83
@Knallli  datetime has nothing to do with TypeError: 'Collection' object is not callable error. Are you a developer?
I know.. I did not want to open another issue for this. It’s two seperate problems
database preperation works now by changing line 82 to `collection = db.market_status`

title: Error running ranking and trading client : TypeError: model_schema() got an unexpected keyword argument 'generic_origin'
body:
Getting an error when running ranking_client and trading_client. I am on Python 3.11.10.

>python ranking_client.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "\AmpyFin\ranking_client.py", line 12, in <module>
    from alpaca.trading.client import TradingClient
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\alpaca\trading\__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from alpaca.trading.client import *
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\alpaca\trading\client.py", line 5, in <module>
    from alpaca.common import RawData
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\alpaca\common\__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from alpaca.common.models import *
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\alpaca\common\models.py", line 6, in <module>
    class ValidateBaseModel(BaseModel, validate_assignment=True):
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_model_construction.py", line 226, in __new__
    complete_model_class(
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_model_construction.py", line 658, in complete_model_class
    schema = cls.__get_pydantic_core_schema__(cls, handler)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\main.py", line 702, in __get_pydantic_core_schema__
    return handler(source)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_schema_generation_shared.py", line 84, in __call__       
    schema = self._handler(source_type)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_generate_schema.py", line 612, in generate_schema        
    schema = self._generate_schema_inner(obj)
             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_generate_schema.py", line 881, in _generate_schema_inner 
    return self._model_schema(obj)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "\anaconda3\envs\ampyfin\Lib\site-packages\pydantic\_internal\_generate_schema.py", line 707, in _model_schema
    model_schema = core_schema.model_schema(
                   ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
TypeError: model_schema() got an unexpected keyword argument 'generic_origin'
author: sukhcs

comments.body: There seems to be a compatability issue with the current version of Python with pydantic. You may need to downgrade your Python version and then retry. I will look into this seperately
